GUNNED DOWN.Definition: shot and killed with a gun

IN BROAD DAYLIGHT.Definition: in public, during the day, where everyone could see

CONTRABAND.Definition: goods that are illegal to buy, sell, or own

COPYRIGHT.Definition: the legal right to control who can copy and use creative work

STANDS ACCUSED OF.Definition: is officially said to have committed the crime

TRIAL.Definition: a meeting in court to decide if he is guilty of the crime

HAUNT.Definition: a place he often went to

REASSURANCES.Definition: words that would make people feel less worried

COMPENSATION PACKAGE.Definition: all the money and benefits he got for his job

CASINGS.Definition: the empty shells left after bullets had been fired

EERILY.Definition: strangely, in a way that felt scary or unnatural

CLAIM.Definition: a request for money or help because of damage, loss, or illness

CLAIMS.Definition: requests for money or help because of damage, loss, or illness

CLAIMANT.Definition: the person asking for money or help (by making a claim)

MANHUNT.Definition: an organised search for the criminal or suspect

PEARLY.Definition: shiny and white, like a pearl

FLIRT.Definition: act in a playful way to show romantic interest

RESEMBLANCE.Definition: likeness, how much he looked like the suspect

SUPPRESSOR.Definition: a device on the gun to make it quieter

MANIFESTO.Definition: a written statement of beliefs or goals

FIRESTORM.Definition: a sudden, large amount of anger or debate

PARASITES.Definition: people who live off others without giving anything back

ABSURDITY.Definition: the state of being silly, foolish, or unreasonable

CUSTODY.Definition: being kept by the police or in prison

IN COLD BLOOD.Definition: on purpose, without emotion or pity

SENTENCED.Definition: given a punishment by a court

CHRONIC.Definition: lasting a long time, not going away

FOLK HERO.Definition: a person admired by ordinary people for being brave or rebellious

INUNDATED.Definition: flooded or overwhelmed by too many of them

PASSER-BY.Definition: a person walking past a place

BANKRUPTCY.Definition: the state of not being able to pay debts

LOOPHOLES.Definition: small gaps in the law that allow people to avoid rules

NARRATIVE.Definition: the story or explanation of events

SHIFTED.Definition: changed from one thing to another

FIGUREHEAD.Definition: someone who had the position of leader

PRESIDING OVER.Definition: being in charge of or leading

GRIEVANCES.Definition: complaints or feelings of unfair treatment

DISGUISE.Definition: hide, give a different appearance to

FOR STARTERS.Definition: to begin with, first of all

GREED.Definition: a strong desire to have more money or things

CRONYISM.Definition: unfair help given to friends, especially in business or politics

NICHE.Definition: relating to just a few people

LAUDED.Definition: praised, said to be very good

FEDERAL.Definition: connected to the central government of the US

PURSUE.Definition: push forward, have as a goal

ELBOWED.Definition: forced its way in, pushed in roughly

DETERRENT.Definition: something that stopped people from doing something bad

SWORN IN.Definition: officially started by taking an oath

SEIZED ON.Definition: quickly took hold of it to use it

DETER.Definition: prevent or discourage people from committing crimes

MARTYR.Definition: a person who died for his beliefs

SEND THIS INTO OVERDRIVE.Definition: make it much stronger or more active

SPIRALLED.Definition: grew quickly and out of control

LASHING OUT.Definition: suddenly attacking or shouting in anger

UNSETTLING.Definition: making people feel worried or nervous

SIMMERING.Definition: slowly building up under the surface

TRIGGER.Definition: the part of the gun he pulled to fire it
